newsitem.title: UK: Dentsu opens office in Vietnam, cites ad growth.
newsitem.headline: Dentsu opens office in Vietnam, cites ad growth.

text.p: Dentsu Inc, the world's largest advertising agency, said on Tuesday it had opened a new office in Vietnam in response to rapid growth in the economy and the advertising industry.
Tokyo-based Dentsu said in a statement received in London that total advertising expenditure in Vietnam was doubling every year and was expected to continue to grow quickly due to foreign investment.
Dentsu opened its first office in Vietnam three months ago, in the commercial centre of Ho Chi Minh City. It opened its second "representative office" in the capital, Hanoi, on October 1.
Dentsu said total advertising expenditure in Vietnam had shot up from $8.0 million in 1992 to $12 million in 1993, $70 million in 1994, $140 in 1995 and $270 million in 1996.
"This repeated doubling suggests a strong likelihood of continued expansion in the industry," Dentsu said.
It said Vietnam's rapid economic growth and an increasing amount of Japanese investment made it an attractive market for advertising.
Dentsu said Vietnam's Gross Domestic Product rose 9.5 percent in 1995, the fastest rate since Hanoi adopted wide-sweeping economic reforms in the late 1980s.
"This result means that Vietnam's economy has grown at a rate exceeding 8.0 percent for four consecutive years since 1992," the statement said.
Dentsu said Japanese companies made 47 different investments in Vietnam totalling $1.13 billion in 1995, which placed Japan second only to Taiwan in terms of the biggest foreign investors in Vietnam.
It said advertising in Vietnam, which abandoned a centrally-planned economic system in the 1980s, was meant to "make a positive contribution to the public profit".

"With the entrance of foreign corporations, however, the introduction of a free economy and the policy of opening up to the outside world, the advertising business is becomingly increasingly active," Dentsu said.
"Dentsu's establishment of another representative office in this energetic market is a response to this market activity," it said.
Advertising Age, the U.S. weekly, ranks Dentsu as the world's biggest ad agency, with $1.93 billion gross income. The second biggest is U.S.-based McCann-Erickson Worldwide.
